solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = _{j}_ \times _{k}_\times \frac 12 \times _{l}_\times((2 \times _{j}_)-30)\)
\(= _{{(j*k)*Decimal('0.5')*(l*((2*j)-30))}}_ m^2\)
Rate of flow = _{m}_ km/hr = _{{1000*m}}_ m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= _{{(j*k)*Decimal('0.5')*(l*((2*j)-30))}}_ \times _{{1000*m}}_ = _{{(j*k)*Decimal('0.5')*(l*((2*j)-30))*(1000*m)}}_ m^3/hr\)
= _{{(j*k)*Decimal('0.5')*(l*((2*j)-30))*m}}_ megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7 \)hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times _{{(j*k)*Decimal('0.5')*(l*((2*j)-30))*m}}_\)
= _{{168*(j*k)*Decimal('0.5')*(l*((2*j)-30))*m}}_ megalitres

content.text: The Surya river is a small unknown river that flows into the Arabian Sea. The cross-section of the river can be approximated as the shape shown in the diagram below. You measure the dimensions of the river and find that a = _{j}_ m, b = _{{j-30}}_ m, c = _{k}_ m and d= _{{k+l}}_ m. The river flows at a constant rate of _{m}_ km / hr. What volume of water (in megalitres) flows into the sea over the course of a week? Note that 1 megalitre = 1000000 litres
